__e: Well, I've got a pretty good-looking résumé already and it's not a big thing because I say so, ma'am.
Here's my number and my CV. I love children. As you do too, I'm sure.
But give me your resume and I'll see what I can do.
It might be that when I put "proficient" on my CV, what I meant to say was "low basic", or more like "not a clue".
And that wouldn't look very good on a young doctor's résumé, would it?
I'm really sorry but do you think you can let me have a look at her résumé from when she joined?

And it's a good thing to have on my résumé for med school.
And yes, I want an extracurricular on my resume for college, but it's not just that.
